name: Meriton Serviced Apartments World Tower

reviews.text: Our family of five (including the visiting inlaws) stayed at the Meriton earlier this month during a quick sight seeing trip to Sydney.
reviews.title: Meriton - Perfect location for Sydney stay.

likes.liked: — Great location, views and quality of the apartment.
likes.disliked: — Starting to show wear and tear...needs maintenance.

reviews.text: Fantastic!!! The Meriton is perfectly placed for a visit - near the corner of George St near the cinemas. This makes it very accessible for public transport and cabs. There is a shopping centre underneath the plaza area on which the apartments sit - very convenient for small shopping trips to stock up on supplies.
reviews.title: Amazing apartment, great view

likes.disliked: — Nothing! Was very happy with my stay.

reviews.text: We had a three bedroom apartment on the 72nd floor. There were two bathrooms and each bedroom had a king size bed so lots of room for everyone. There was a sofabed in the living room.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Facilities

likes.liked: — The fully equipped kitchen, laundry facilities, bedrooms, bathrooms and the living room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathrooms, kitchen and bedrooms were all top notch. The beds were hard (very hard!) but we didn't travel to Sydney for the beds. Views out of the windows were amazing and very impressive to the visitors.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay

likes.disliked: — lots of active in reception area

reviews.text: The apartment was starting to show wear and tear which probably needs to be addressed - and it would have been nice for the reservations staff to point out that there is a gorgeous indoor pool for guest use. Maybe next time.
reviews.title: Loved this apartment!

likes.liked: — The location, the space and the comfort

reviews.text: After reading the Tripadvisor reviews I booked a 2-bedroom here for the family via the hotel website. Arrived early, had a fast check-in and they stored my luggage. The reception was nice an efficient. Returned after 2 to get the room key. Also nice and efficient and helped me retreive my luggage.
reviews.title: Almost perfect. Just the aircon timer and hard beds.

reviews.text: The room is an amazing. We were all amazing at the view, and spent time just standing on the little nook to take it in. The kitchen, baths, and bedrooms were all top notch. Amazing space in a nice, new apartment.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: The only two nibble (already mentioned here) are the 4 hour timer on the aircon (have to wake up to turn it back on), and the relatively hard beds. But those are just minor quibbles in an amazing hotel.
reviews.title: stunning views, large and clean apartment

reviews.text: This provides apartment living in the central CBD. Easy to find. Very spacious rooms with terrific views. Internet available in your room or they have an internet room. Tremendous Gym, did the treadmill overlooking Easter suburbs. Nice pool. Is right beside the monorial but easy walk to Chinatown and Darling Harbour, movies, shopping, buses. Some great coffee shops, restaurants underneath building. Staff very helpful and went out of their way to get me in early as I arrived at 8am.
reviews.title: Good but better elsewhere

reviews.text: stayed at property at the start of a round the world trip.
reviews.title: Who needs to climb the bridge with this view!

likes.liked: — Having 3 bedrooms. Great views. Kitchen facilities.
likes.disliked: — Lack of cooking utensils and pots etc.

reviews.text: We stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment with 6 friends for one evening early in Feb. The hotel is relatively easy to find, the access to the parking is not and there is no where to stop out the front and ask instructions. Once inside we were checked in quickly and we surprised by the lack of security in the foyer. People can come and go as they please but you do need a security pass to access the lifts. There was obviously a tour group there as the lobby was full of people milling around at 1130 at night!
reviews.title: No where near a 5 star stay

reviews.text: The layout and views of the room could not be faulted. It was a large amount of space for 6 people and we were very comfortable. The air conditioning however left a lot to be desired as there was no air flow in the rooms and it turned off during the night. The instructions for the air conditioning had been helpfully removed from the guest services folder. Beds were firm but ok. The foxtel in the main room did not flow into the guest rooms. Overall we payed a lot for the view and I would probably not return. The lack of an inbuilt place for breakfast was annoying but when pressed staff reccomended a couple of places.
reviews.title: Huge apartment, amazing view, perfect location

reviews.text: I stayed here with a friend and my 10 month old daughter and we loved it. I am planning my next trip back already. The bedrooms were very spacious, gorgeous clean bathrooms, well equiped kitchen and laundry. The living area was huge with the most amazing views over Sydney. This is a serviced apartment so they don't do something that you would expect in a hotel like have a porter or baby cots but they were very quick to help us with the few requests that we did have. Absolutely going back to Sydney and this will be the first place I try to book for our stay.
reviews.title: Ideal for families in the city

reviews.text: My family and I took advantage of the views at New Year. We have a 7 month old so couldn't go to the fireworks ourselves. Perfect. Staff were really helpful when we asked for the best view and let us see 3 apartments before we chose one! Can't complain about much, but add to the niggles about cheap equipment (bendy forks, ironing board collapsing under its own weight) and air conditioning. You could do a lot worse and with children I wouldn't consider anything else.
reviews.title: Potential to be exceptional ... but

likes.liked: — The view, proximity to monorail, shops, restaurants

reviews.text: The views from the 65 floor are exceptional. We booked a three bed apartment for four adults and two children. The space, especially in the living areas is outstanding. The kitchen has everything you will need. My pet "peeves" were minor but given we stayed a week and paid close to AU$800 per night for four of the seven nights, I feel some of these were justified. The airconditioning turning off every four hours is really annoying especially when it is particularly hot and humid as it was during our stay. The beds and pillows are appalling. I have stayed in caravan parks that had better quality mattresses than the Meriton. Again, for the money you are paying, it wouldn't take much to improve these two (repeatedly complained about) issues. There is a monorail station below the apartment, along with a heap of shops - coles, liquorland etc - all are open quite late. Waiting for lifts can also be a real issue, especially between 8:30 - 10:00 am and again around meal times. We regularly waited up to 20 minutes. Staff were "relatively" helpful - I say relatively because unless you really pumped them for information on the surrounding area/restaurants etc, they didn't go out of their way to volunteer this. The departing invoice is not at all straight forward and when I asked for an explanation, it was given quite reluctantly. My husband has previously stayed at the Meriton in Pitt Street, so perhaps we will try that one next time.
reviews.title: Gawk, gawk, WOW
Beautiful Room
reviews.text: Beautiful Room - views were lovely and the rooms were so spacious. The enclosed balcony was also an added bonus, as were the heated towel racks in the gorgeous bathrooms. Pool had a magnificant view. Cant complain about the actual hotel at all. Although I must agree with some of the other reviewers of the service. It was appalling! I waited a good 20 minutes to even be acknowledged at check in. If they can clean up their act with the service, then I would truely classify this as a 5* hotel.

reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised
reviews.text: We were staying with out of country guests and were very interested in a room with a view. As such, we were willing to take a gamble on slow elevators, no air conditioning and poor service. (as noted in other reviews)

reviews.title: breathtaking views over the harbour!
reviews.text: We stayed on the 74th floor and never waited for more than one minute for an elevator and the air conditioning made a native Minnesotan put on extra layers. (Sydney was sunny and mid 20's both days) I could see how check-in queues could get long based on the desk staff numbers but this was not an issue when we checked in at 4pm on a Sunday.

reviews.title: great views but poor service
reviews.text: The 3 bedroom apartment was VERY spacious for 4 adults and 2 children and the pillows and beds were extremely comfortable. The kitchen was well fitted and even included plastic storage containers. At $273 AUD a night it sure beat 2 hotel rooms.
The complex is less than a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour and had a Coles grocery store and liquor store at the end of the block.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Great!!!!!
reviews.text: Booked throught accommodation wholesalers australia and i found this the best place i stayed in sydney!
great views, clean big apartments (3 bedroom) and i didnt have 1 complaint would certainly stay there again
reviews.title: The view is amazing at the Meriton World Tower

reviews.text: Booked four nights at the Meriton World Tower's on WOTIF and was very impressed with our three bedroom apartment on the 72nd floor. I requested a high level floor mainly to get an unobstructed view over other buildings. The apartment was $249 per night and was spacious and the view was truely special out to Sydney Heads and Eastern Suburbs. The apartments are large and had two bathrooms. The pool area is great with a spa and sauna area attached. Small things that need attention eg no pool towels, housekeeping always later in the day around 3ish, reception staff not overly friendly or interested in you (apart from swipping your credit card) means that I would rate it 4.5**. The location is fantastic and the monorail stop is right next door and there are shops and a Coles suprmarket underneath the building. I will return but definitely ask for a high level apartment as the view is amazing.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!!!

reviews.text: If you are traveling with a family look no further. This is going to be the best deal you find in the city. The location is out of this world (2 blocks from Darling Harbour) and the views are to die for. We booked a 3-bedroom luxury apartment and paid less than the cost for most hotel room in the city.
reviews.title: Amazing view

reviews.text: Our unit was located on the 73rd floor. Keep in mind that the Meriton World Tower is one of the tallest buildings in Sydney. When you first enter the unit you have a large foyer with a desk, phone and oversized closet. This place had more closets than most family homes! The kitchen was fully stocked with plates, silverware, and cleaning supplies. A double oven, stovetop and stainless steel refridgerator as well. The living and dining rooms were larger than most hotel rooms. The living area had a modern L-shaped couch, LCD TV and a DVD player. The entire unit has floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city. We weren't on the Darling Harbour side:-( but our view was still spectacular. It was like looking down on a street map!
reviews.title: Perfect extended-stay experience

likes.liked: — Location, room size, non-smoking, kitchen and laundry in-room, views

reviews.text: World Tower is an excellent choice! I had read many of the reviews on this site before booking my recent two-week stay with Meriton Reality at World Tower. My stay, in a one bedroom on the 36th floor, was truly excellent. I should mention the following:
reviews.title: All Around Excellent!

reviews.text: 1. The apartment was spacious, very nice, and like new, with great balconys, furntiture, etc., and they provide more than enough clean dishes, pots, etc to make great use of the apartment while there.
reviews.title: Great Apartments with the Best Views!

likes.disliked: — Cardio equipment not facing the great views!

reviews.text: 2. The room service I received was excellent. Daily they tidy up and provide more than enough new dishwashing and laundry detergents, towels, etc., and they often cleaned up thoroughly which even included doing any dishes that needed it at that time.
reviews.title: Great family stay - highly recommended

reviews.text: 3. The amenities were superb. I used either the gym, pool, sauna, or whirlpool every day and they were always available and had great views.
reviews.title: Spacious and Views!!!
On Top of The World
reviews.text: 4. The location was ideal. World Square at the ground level and beneath has lots of restaurants, markets, other shopping. I was also just a short walk to Darling Harbor, the Queen Victoria Building, Sky Tower, etc.

aka: Meriton Serviced Apartments World Tower Hotel Sydney
description: Meriton Serviced Apartments World Tower offers exceptional high-rise accommodation in Sydney’s tallest residential building. With 115 oversized apartments designed for living in two and three bedroom configurations this property positions you right in the heart of the city. Towering over the city all apartments start from the 61st floor and have sweeping panoramic views guaranteed to impress from the floor to ceiling windows. Below the building is the World Square Shopping Centre with a Coles Supermarket, Liquorland, Gloria Jeans, JB HI-FI, Priceline, Nandos and many other specialty and fashion stores, food outlets and ATMs. An energectic walk leads you to Darling Harbour and The Star casino. Or you can walk to Town Hall Station, Chinatown, Haymarket, Hyde Park, Pitt Street Mall, Capitol Theatre and Queen Victoria Building (QVB). All multi-million dollar apartments have a full sized European kitchen and a separate laundry, which includes clothes washer, dryer, iron and ironing board. Apartments are fully air-conditioned for your comfort. All apartments were re-furbished during November 2010.
